a) In METHYLACETATE, PCL forms a colloidal mixture, creating a suspension of fine particles. Overall, it presents colloidal, as there is no visible insoluble particle, and reflection area of the laser is bright and obvious/dense. b) This sample of PDMS easily dissolves in HEPTANE, forming a homogenous solution. Overall, it presents soluble, as there is no visible insoluble particle, and reflection area of the laser is not obvious/sparse.
In an emergency, which of the objects above can be used to break through thin ice covering a car outside?
Select only one most appropriate object for this scenario based on soluble property descriptions of the two objects. Use the format 'The most suitable object is x), because xxx'
The most suitable object is b).
